article.title: Models of Prime-Like Sequences Generated by Least Element Sieve Operations Like the Sieve of Eratosthenes

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the logarithmic integral function, denoted by li(n). What does this function estimate in the context of prime numbers?
choices: The sum of the reciprocals of all prime numbers less than or equal to n.
The number of twin prime pairs less than or equal to n.
The average gap between consecutive prime numbers less than or equal to n.
The number of prime numbers less than or equal to n.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the Riemann zeta function, denoted by Î¶(s). What is a significant unsolved problem related to the non-trivial zeros of this function?
This formula represents a conjecture about the error term in the Prime Number Theorem. What aspect of the distribution of prime numbers does this conjecture address?
choices: The divisibility properties of prime numbers.
The relationship between prime numbers and perfect squares.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of the alternative sieve model presented in the paper, what does this formula represent?
choices: The number of integers remaining after the n-th stage of sieving.
The value of the n-th "prime" generated by the model.
The density of integers remaining after the n-th stage of sieving.
The period of the sequence generated after the n-th stage of sieving.
